sources.title: Thunder in Carolina (1960) RORY CALHOUN
sources.description:
It's FRIDAY @ PizzaFLIX
Starring: Rory Calhoun, Alan Hale Jr., Connie Hines
Director: Paul Helmick

Fasten your seat belts for the SOUND & the FURY of one of Quentin Tarantino’s FAVORITE racing films. The action takes place during the actual Labor Day 1959 "Southern 500" at Darlington Raceway, nicknamed "The Track Too Tough to Tame" by many NASCAR drivers. 

Heartthrob Rory Calhoun stars as a legendary stock car racer who is fast on the track and faster with women. With co-cars, a pre-Gilligan's Island Alan Hale Jr., and Mr. Ed’s Connie Hines in her first and last movie.

metadata.Plot: Professional stock car racer Mitch Cooper wrecks his car and hurts his ankle in a brutal smash-up. Mitch takes time off from racing to teach cocky eager beaver kid Les York how to drive well on the track. Mitch also takes a fancy to York's lovely, no-nonsense wife Rene. This leads to York ditching Mitch as his manager so he can race for some evil jerk millionaire who only cares about winning.
metadata.Actors: Rory Calhoun, Alan Hale Jr., Connie Hines
